id.description: Unique identifier for the user profile.

bio.description: A short biography or description of the user.

skills.description: An array of skills possessed by the user.

roles.description: An array of roles assigned to the user (e.g., 'admin', 'developer', 'customer').

Service.title: Service
Service.description: Represents a service offered by the company.

description.description: A detailed description of the service.

DesignOrder.title: DesignOrder
DesignOrder.description: Represents a design order placed by a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the design order.

description.description: A description of the design order requirements.

dueDate.description: The due date for the design order.

status.description: The current status of the design order (e.g., pending, in progress, completed).

Appointment.title: Appointment
Appointment.description: Represents an appointment booked by a user.

startTime.description: The start time of the appointment.

endTime.description: The end time of the appointment.

location.description: The location of the appointment (online or physical).

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product listed on the online marketplace.

sellerId.description: Reference to UserProfile representing the seller. (Relationship: UserProfile 1:N Product)

description.description: A detailed description of the product.

QuotationRequest.title: QuotationRequest
QuotationRequest.description: Represents a quotation request submitted by a client.

id.description: Unique identifier for the quotation request.

requirements.description: A detailed description of the client's requirements for the project.

quotation.description: The generated quotation based on the client's requirements.

dateRequested.description: The date the quotation was requested.

name.description: The name of the package (e.g., 115 Diamonds).

price.description: The price of the package in LKR.

imageUrl.description: URL for the package image, if not a gem package.

order.description: The display order of the package.

TopupOrder.title: TopupOrder
TopupOrder.description: Represents a top-up order placed by a user.

userId.description: The ID of the user who placed the order (if logged in).

userEmail.description: The email of the user (if available).

playerId.description: The in-game Player ID for the top-up.

packageId.description: The ID of the selected top-up package.

packageName.description: The name of the selected top-up package.

packagePrice.description: The price of the package at the time of order.

status.description: The current status of the order.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the order was created.

PaymentSettings.title: PaymentSettings
PaymentSettings.description: Stores the settings for available payment methods.

Chat.title: Chat
Chat.description: Represents a chat thread between a user and an admin.

userId.description: The ID of the user participating in the chat.

userEmail.description: The email of the user for identification.

lastMessage.description: The text of the last message sent in the chat.

Message.title: Message
Message.description: Represents a single message within a chat.

senderId.description: The UID of the user who sent the message.

timestamp.description: The time the message was sent.

Testimonial.title: Testimonial
Testimonial.description: Represents a customer testimonial for display on the website.

name.description: The name of the person giving the testimonial.

position.description: The job title or role of the person.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the testimonial was created.

userId.description: The ID of the user who submitted it.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure authorization independence, clarity, and scalability. User profiles, services, products, and top-up packages are stored in top-level collections. User-specific data like design orders, appointments, and quotation requests are stored in subcollections under the user's profile document. This approach leverages path-based ownership for private user data, simplifying security rules and enabling efficient data retrieval. The structure supports required QAPs via structural segregation. Products have `sellerId`, so product listings are secure. User-owned resources are namespaced under `/users/{userId}` to support listing only the data owned by a specific user. New top-level collections for `topupOrders`, `settings`, `testimonials`, and `tournaments` are added to handle the new functionality.
